intro: Morisonia didymobotrys, commonly known as the twin-flowered morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with palmate leaves and clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts due to its ornamental value and limited distribution.
